verses.roman:
bandhūnām icchatāṁ dātuṁ
kṛṣṇāya bhaginīṁ nṛpa
tato nivārya kṛṣṇa-dviḍ
rukmī caidyam amanyata

synonyms: bandhūnām—her family members; icchatām—even as they were desiring; dātum—to give; kṛṣṇāya—to Kṛṣṇa; bhaginīm—their sister; nṛpa—O King; tataḥ—from this; nivārya—preventing them; kṛṣṇa-dviṭ—hateful of Kṛṣṇa; rukmī—Rukmī; caidyam—Caidya (Śiśupāla); amanyata—considered.
translation: Because Rukmī envied the Lord, O King, he forbade his family members to give his sister to Kṛṣṇa, although they wanted to. Instead, Rukmī decided to give Rukmiṇī to Śiśupāla.

purport.content: Rukmī abused his position as elder brother and acted with impure motives. He would only suffer for his decision.
